title: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn talks Sinead Tinker's death from cervical cancer
text:
Coronation Street viewers were left devastated on Friday night as Sinead Tinker finally lost her fight with cervical cancer.

And following the heartbreaking scenes, actress Katie McGlynn revealed that she didn't feel like she was watching herself, as she reflected on her character's passing.

In an interview with The Mirror, the soap star, 26, said that she felt that 'someone else had died' after almost seven years of developing the character, adding that she no longer takes life for granted amid the plot.

End of an era: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn revealed that she didn't feel like she was watching herself, as she reflected on her character Sinead Tinker's passing

Heartbreaking scenes on the ITV soap showed the character’s final day as she said her last goodbyes to her loved ones.

And after a day of holding on, Sinead slipped away as he husband Daniel read a bedtime story to their son Bertie.

The episode was so moving and real for viewers that some struggled to continue watching the scenes.

Speaking of watching the death after year's of developing the character, Katie shared: 'She’s gone now so watching her final days, I don’t feel like I’m watching myself, I feel like I’m watching her. It’s really sad. I feel like someone has died.'

Reflection: In an interview with The Mirror, the soap star, 26, said that she felt that 'someone else had died' after almost seven years of developing the character

The star also opened up how she got into the mindset of the ailing character and admitted that Sinead's plight had her thinking about her own life.

She said: ‘You’ve got to tap into them emotions in order to get yourself there. I just feel like it was real from start to finish, so when you get home you can’t switch off.

‘For my life personally how it’s changed. I don’t want to be cheesy but I don’t take life for granted as much as I did. I’ve been a bit more emotional with my friends and family.'

Sinead was diagnosed with cancer last year while pregnant with her son Bertie.

The character made the decision to put off having chemotherapy so as to protect her unborn baby.

Tragic: 'She’s gone now so watching her final days, I don’t feel like I’m watching myself, I feel like I’m watching her'

Hard: 'You’ve got to tap into them emotions in order to get yourself there. I just feel like it was real from start to finish, so when you get home you can’t switch off'

However, she was tragically told recently that she had just weeks to live, leaving her and her loved ones devastated.

In Friday's hour-long special, her final moments with her family were played out, and featured several fading scenes emulating the moments the Underworld worker fell asleep as her body grew weaker and weaker by the hour.

And Katie told how she didn't want the storyline to have a 'fairy tale' ending as she wanted to properly raise awareness, adding that she hoped viewers in a similar situation found it 'cathartic'.

Following the episode, Katie took to social media to thank fans from the 'bottom of my heart' for following Sinead's journey.

Changed: 'For my life personally how it’s changed. I don’t want to be cheesy but I don’t take life for granted as much as I did'

Thank you: Following the episode, actress Katie McGlynn took to social media to thank fans from the 'bottom of my heart' for following Sinead's journey

On your side: She then gave a supportive message to those affected by cancer, writing: 'To every single person that is, or has been affected by cancer, stay strong!'

Alongside an image of her in character, she wrote: 'Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your amazing support and love..thank you to every single person who makes Coronation Street the brilliant show that it is and most importantly, THANK YOU to every single viewer for following Sinead’s journey.'

She then gave a supportive message to those affected by cancer, writing: 'To every single person that is, or has been affected by cancer, stay strong!

'Seek comfort in family, friends and loved ones. Don’t be afraid to ask for help and don’t be afraid to feel however it is you feel! My heart is with you all, be brave and fight.'

Ahead of the heartbreaking onscreen death, Katie shared a heartfelt Instagram post featuring a quote from her alter ego.

Goodbye: The actress also took to Twitter where she bid farewell to Sinead after seven years and thanked her fans for their unwavering support throughout the tragic storyline

Touching: Ahead of her demise on Friday, Katie shared a snap of herself in character and quote from Sinead, which was said in a recent episode

The actress also took to Twitter where she bid farewell to Sinead after seven years and thanked her fans for their unwavering support throughout the tragic storyline.

For months fans of the ITV soap have watched as Sinead battled to fight the cruel disease, with the character learning in recent weeks that she had very little time left to live.

And ahead of her demise on Friday, Katie shared a snap of herself in character and quote from Sinead, which was said in a recent episode.

She wrote: 'If I’ve learnt one thing in my 25 years on this planet, nice can change the world.” Sinead Osbourne @coronationstreet you’ll always be my home #corrie#cervicalcancer #sinead #daniel.'

Elsewhere, several fans too to Twitter to share their devastation at the scenes:

So sad: The previous day, the TV star also revealed she was struggling to watch this week's scenes which saw the Underworld worker's life slowly ebb away

Tough to watch: Taking to Twitter, several fans shared their devastation at watching the deeply emotional scenes

‘This is just heartbreaking #Corrie,’ wrote one viewer.

As another shared: ‘Christ, if you aren't crying watching #Corrie right now are you even human? This is heartbreaking.’

A third upset fan tweeted: ‘I’m sobbing this is heartbreaking #corrie.’

‘I can't watch this, especially when you know this is life for so many people in the world, It just isn't fair #cancer #corrie,’ shared a fourth.

If you've been affected by this storyline, please call Macmillan cancer support on 0808 808 00 00 or visit www.macmillan.org.uk

Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
description: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn, 26, discussed Sinead Tinker's death and revealed she no longer takes life for granted amid cervical cancer plot.
